results.title: Fair play
results.creator_credit: Edmund Penney, Jack Wipper and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description: The film encourages judgements on three situations which occur in play. The experiences of the playground are important social lessons. Sharing, kindness and responsibility for each other’s well being are some of the elements of “fair play”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Edmund Penney, Jack Wipper and Sterling Educational Films

results.title: Kittens grow up
results.creator_credit: Hugh Johnston, Suzanne Johnston and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: Studies the development of kittens from immediately after birth, through learning to walk, until they gain the ability to co-ordinate all their activities. Also covers the role of the mother cat in this development. Sequal to ‘Kittens are born’. Suitable for upper primary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hugh Johnston, Suzanne Johnston and McGraw-Hill Films

results.title: Kittens are born
results.creator_credit: Hugh Johnston, Suzanne Johnston and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: Follows a female cat from pregnancy through labour and the birth of three kittens. Emphasises the birth process and parental care immediately following birth. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Clay: or the origin of the species
results.creator_credit: Eliot Noyes, Contemporary Films and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: An art film in which three-dimensional forms of modelling clay are used to express a visual and amusing variation on a theory of evolution as suggested by the simple lifeforms which emerge from graphic motions of a clay sea. Best Film, 6th Annual Annecy film festival.

results.title: Anatomy of an inflation
results.creator_credit: Philip S. Goodman, Charles N. Burnaford and Federal Motion Pictures
results.brief_description: Inflation traditionally has resulted from excess demand pushing prices up when the economy is not operating at capacity. However, when the “production machine” is producing all that it can, increased demand cannot result in the production of more goods. Instead, the increased demand simply pushes prices up. As a result of viewing this film, students will be able to discuss what an inflation is, what its causes are, and how inflations can differ. They will also be able to understand the role of government with regard to business and the economy. Narrated by Edwin Newman. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Philip S. Goodman, Charles N. Burnaford and Federal Motion Pictures

results.title: Mountain music
results.creator_credit: Will Vinton and Will Vinton Productions
results.brief_description: A 3-D animated film portraying the impact of modern technology on the planet. The happy and tranquil life of forest creatures is changed by three musicians whose amplified sounds, cause the eruption of a mountain. Animated by Bevan Vinton, Bob Gardiner and Will Vinton. Featuring Kath Hendrickson. Music by Bill Scream and Paul Jameson.

results.title: Basic film editing
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford Educational Films and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: This film illustrates basic techniques of piecing a film together. The camera viewpoint, as well as long, medium and close-up shots, are manipulated to vary effects. No other credits available.

results.title: The Tool users
results.creator_credit: Jack Kaufman Productions and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: Demonstrates that humans are not the only animal that has developed the ability to fashion and use tools. Shows a variety of animals using tools in their daily routine. Narrated by Leslie Nielsen.

results.title: Tobias on the evolution of man
results.brief_description:
Summarises Phillip Tobias’ contribution to paleoanthropology. He discusses the evolution of man, considering various hominid species and their relationship to homosapiens.
Suitable for upper secondary level.
